attributes.action: Regulate third party vehicle insurance prices
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to introduce a cap on third party car insurance prices for all motorists who have no more than 6 points on their licence, less than 3 fault claims in the last 5 years and want to insure a standard vehicle (for example up to a value of £100k) regardless of their occupation, age or address. Also make it illegal for insurers to refuse to offer such an insurance for anyone. If anyone wants TPFT / comprehensive that would be on top of the government regulated prices.
attributes.background: Third party vehicle insurance is the minimum legal requirement. This should be regulated by government to stop insurers from unreasonably hiking prices for some people.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about car insurance prices are a matter for insurers, not the UK Government or Parliament.
